ul.li: PowerOfAttorney is a kind of AdvanceDirective

section.title: Description
section.p: A legal document (as a living will or durable power of attorney for healthcare) signed by a competent person to provide guidance for medical and health-care decisions (as the termination of life support or organ donation) in the event the person becomes incompetent to make such decisions.

stentry.p: Categorizes the kind of Advance Directive.
"Indicates the patient's instructions to the healthcare facility." - HL7 Version 2.8, PD1-15.
"The date that ... the advance directive [was] last validated." - HL7 Version 2.8, PD1-21.
The time period over which the Advance Directive is effective. Note that the end date is typically blank for active Advance Directives.
A scanned image of the signed paper form, if applicable.
Information to locate the original paper form, if applicable.
See Act Instance Status definition for values.

Indicates the state of the Advance Directive, as defined in the Act state-transition model in the HL7 RIM. Possible values include: New, Held, Canceled, Active, Suspended, Aborted, Completed, Nullified, and Obsolete.
